At present, all installations large or small, used for the storage of petroleum spirit require the licence of the local authority, and the effect of the Bill therefore, so far as they are concerned, is only to substitute in the case of the large installations the licence of the Secretary of State for that of the local authority. Installations for the storage of petroleum other than petroleum spirit do not at present require as such to be lioensed under the Act of 1871, but I am informed that all, or almost all, the large installations which will he affected by the Bill are used for both kinds of storage.The Bill also makes certain other amendments in the Petroleum Acts, especially for improving the control over the conveyance of petroleum by road and on ship, which were reoommended by a Departmental Committee appointed by the Home Office in 1913, and some of which are urgently required" She Bill is not likely to excite any controversy and I ask authority for its immediate introduction,,2nd February, 1923.V/. 0.
